Name: Bertha Agustina
description: The city of Portoviejo is known as the city of the royal tamarinds. It was affected by the earthquake of April 16, 2016. It is located in the Portoviejo river valley, and the city is rich in the production of vegetables, legumes and tropical fruit for domestic consumption. Bertha is 43 years old. She is separated and she has 4 children, three of whom are grown and independent, and one who is 10 and in school. Bertha and her sister make food for social events that order banquets from them. Generally, they work Saturdays and Sundays, depending on what time the vent will be. She has been in this business for 4 years. She also works Monday through Friday as an assistant cook at a restaurant for 8 hours, and evenings she helps her father, who is elderly and has the tradition of selling popcorn from a cart outside of chuches. With this new loan, she will buy an industrial stove to continue preparing her food. She likes the loans because they are quick and the interests are low. Her dream is to own her own restaurant.
